title: 820-00281 no power
message:
This arrived with liquid damage on U3100/3200 area. Reflowed evrything with good flux but still stuck at 5V. PP3V3 is present 3.2V

PPBUS_G3H 0V

All LDO voltages are present.

What should be checked next?

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
Check all resistors in that area.
Don't forget to inspect U2890.

All ports have the same behaviour?
Do you get 1V1 LDO on each chip?

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
All resistors are good.

U2890 had liquid damage but cleaned it up with fresh solder.

1V1 LDO present on all chips

title: 820-00281 no power
message: U3100/200 reballed but no change. All LDO voltages still present

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
Test with known good batery, which holds some charge.
Check if USB-C input switch to 20V.
Let see if board tries to start then.

title: 820-00281 no power
message: Can a bad CPU prevent it from switching to 20V? this had liquid damage on many CPU mosfets but resistance to ground values were high so replaced all of them before working on the U3100/3200 area

title: 820-00281 no power
message: CPU is not involved in the power switching process.

title: 820-00281 no power
message: With known good battery usb amp meter goes to 20V but drawing 0 amps

title: 820-00281 no power
message: PPBUS_G3H 11.75v with battery but not shorted

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
Any life sign if you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
Use R5226 pads, instead of power button.

title: 820-00281 no power
message: amp draw remains at 0 while triggering R5226 pads

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
You have battery connected, forget the charger; even you keep it connected too.
The board is powered from battery at this moment.
Check for pulse at the big coils...

title: 820-00281 no power
message: There is no pulse at any of the big coils

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
With battery connected, check if SMC_ONOFF_L stays high?
If yes, then trigger it (as above described) and check for pulse at PM_RSMRST_L and PM_PWRBTN_L.

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
SMC_ONOFF_L   .405v

 PM_RSMRST_L  0v no pulse

 PM_PWRBTN_L  .225v constant no change when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
SMC_ONOFF_L  now 3.4v after replacing R4911

PM_RSMRST_L  .10v  constant no change when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L

PM_PWRBTN_L  .50v constant no change when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L

title: 820-00281 no power
message: Check U7800 (7 OF 10) LDO outputs.

title: 820-00281 no power
message: After fixing SMC_ONNOFF_L board now powers on with chime but no backlight. 12.35V backlight

title: 820-00281 no power
message: Check USB activity and external video.

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
Caps lock light comes on along with external video. 

There was minor liquid damage on LCD connector.  PP5V_SOSW_LCD was 0v, after replacing U9850 PP5V_SOSW_LCD  now 5v but still no backlight

title: 820-00281 no power
message: EDP_BKLT_EN only  0.32v Replaced u9800 but no change

title: 820-00281 no power
message: EDP_BKLT_EN 0.31v   should U9800 be changed???

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
U9800 should be good, if you get external video.
You've said to have 12.5V at backlight output before.
That means EDP_BKLT_EN was high then.

DP_INT_HPD goes high now?

title: 820-00281 no power
message: DP_INT_HPD  3.2v

title: 820-00281 no power
message: 0V at backlight output now?

title: 820-00281 no power
message: PPVOUT_SO_LCDBKLT still 12.3V

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
Really strange...
To get 12V on backlight output, Q8400 must be on.
That is possible if BKLT_SD is low (0V), which requires EDP_BKLT_EN to be present.
"EDP_BKLT_EN 0.31v"
Can you re-check?

title: 820-00281 no power
message: Just checked again  EDP_BKLT_EN still 0.31 and  PPVOUT_SO_LCDBKLT 12.3V

title: 820-00281 no power
message: And BKLT_SD?

title: 820-00281 no power
message: Then Q8400 is bad, shorted D-S; change it.

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
Replaced Q8400

PPVOUT_SO_LCDBKLT  0v

EDP_BKLT_EN 0.30v

BKLT_SD 12.33v

title: 820-00281 no power
message:
Something else was affected by corrosion.

Backlight circuit requires EDP_BKLT_EN.
But also need correct communication with T-CONN via I2C bus (SCL/SDA).

You should test with known good LCD assembly.
Better to change small video cable too.
Be sure J8500 is now good.

title: 820-00281 no power
message: Solved after ultrasonic cleaning
